context: The Finnish word 'koira' means 'dog' in English. It is a common noun that refers to the domesticated canine animal. In Finnish, like many other languages, nouns have different forms depending on their grammatical function - 'koira' can appear in various cases such as nominative (koira), genitive (koiran), partitive (koiraa), etc. The word is used to refer to male dogs specifically, while females are called 'narttu'. In Finnish sentences, 'koira' often appears with verbs related to animal behavior or ownership.
